sense.name: small glass plate for mounting specimens
sense.examples: The biologist prepared slides for his microscope. THe pathologist examined a slide of the patient's biopsy.

sense.name: descended mass of earth or rock
sense.examples: The coast road is closed because of a mud slide. We saw signs along the highway warning of rock slides.

sense.name: a rapid swooping musical gesture
sense.examples: The guitarist is famous for his slide technique. The young violinist practiced her slides.

sense.name: a chute on a playground
sense.examples: John put up a slide and swing set for his children in the backyard. Tommy loves the slides at the water park.

sense.name: smooth motion across a surface
sense.examples: The car's slide on the ice took it across two lanes of traffic. The runner made a slide for home base. She liked to feel the slide of smooth silk against her skin.

sense.name: viewable image or transparency
sense.commentary: SLIDE[+artifact][+image][+viewable] Note: before the age of PowerPoint, slides were physical transparencies; the term now is widely extended to viewable, sequenced images on a computer.
sense.examples: We found boxes of old 35mm slides in the attic. Mary is preparing her slides for her lecture tomorrow. The art history professor went to the next slide, which showed a painting by Delacroix.

sense.name: a sloping channel to move material through
sense.examples: The truck unloaded the coal onto a slide into the basement. The ore is transported downhill along metal slides.

sense.name: a decrease in value
sense.examples: The markets continued their slide into bear territory this week. The slide in housing prices has made many homeowners decide to stay put.
